attributes.release_summary:
# Changelog
## 12.3.2

- Suppress benign idmap logged error

## 12.3.1

- Handle passwords with backslash correctly

## 12.3.0

- Upgrade Alpine Linux to 3.19

## 12.2.0

- Decrease Samba log level

## 12.1.0

- Use the new Home Assistant folder for the `
attributes.title: Samba share

attributes.release_summary:
# Changelog

## 9.15.0

- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.36.0

## 9.14.0

- Upgrade Home Assistant CLI to 4.34.0

## 9.13.0

- Enable ha command completion for non-login shell (e.g. the web terminal)

## 9.12.0

- Install completions for ha commands
- Fi
attributes.title: Terminal & SSH

attributes.release_summary:
# Matterbridge Official Home Assistant Add-on

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

If you like this project and find it useful, please consider giving it a star on GitHub at https://github.com/Luligu/matterbridge-home-ass
attributes.title: Matterbridge Home Assistant Add-on

attributes.attribution: Weather forecast from met.no, delivered by the Norwegian Meteorological Institute.

attributes.friendly_name: Light (XY, HS and CT) On level
Smoke alarm sensor End of service
Smoke alarm sensor Test in progress
Smoke alarm sensor Interconnected smoke alarm
Smoke alarm sensor Interconnected CO alarm

create.name: Create
create.description: Shows a notification on the notifications panel.

notification_id.name: Notification ID
notification_id.description: ID of the notification. This new notification will overwrite an existing notification with the same ID.

dismiss.name: Dismiss
dismiss.description: Removes a notification from the notifications panel.

notification_id.name: Notification ID
notification_id.description: ID of the notification to be removed.

dismiss_all.name: Dismiss all
dismiss_all.description: Removes all notifications from the notifications panel.

save_persistent_states.name: Save persistent states
save_persistent_states.description: Saves the persistent states immediately. Maintains the normal periodic saving interval.

turn_off.name: Generic turn off
turn_off.description: Generic action to turn devices off under any domain.

turn_on.name: Generic turn on
turn_on.description: Generic action to turn devices on under any domain.

toggle.name: Generic toggle
toggle.description: Generic action to toggle devices on/off under any domain.

check_config.name: Check configuration
check_config.description: Checks the Home Assistant YAML-configuration files for errors. Errors will be shown in the Home Assistant logs.

update_entity.name: Update entity
update_entity.description: Forces one or more entities to update its data.

entity_id.name: Entities to update
entity_id.description: List of entities to force update.

reload_core_config.name: Reload core configuration
reload_core_config.description: Reloads the core configuration from the YAML-configuration.

reload_custom_templates.name: Reload custom Jinja2 templates
reload_custom_templates.description: Reloads Jinja2 templates found in the `custom_templates` folder in your config. New values will be applied on the next render of the template.

entry_id.name: Config entry ID
entry_id.description: The configuration entry ID of the entry to be reloaded.

reload_all.name: Reload all
reload_all.description: Reload all YAML configuration that can be reloaded without restarting Home Assistant.

set_default_level.name: Set default level
set_default_level.description: Sets the default log level for integrations.

level.name: Level
level.description: Default severity level for all integrations.

set_level.name: Set level
set_level.description: Sets the log level for one or more integrations.

logger.name: Logger
logger.description: Logger name under which to log the message. Defaults to `system_log.external`.

set_theme.name: Set the default theme
set_theme.description: Sets the default theme Home Assistant uses. Can be overridden by a user.

purge.name: Purge
purge.description: Starts purge task - to clean up old data from your database.

keep_days.name: Days to keep
keep_days.description: Number of days to keep the data in the database. Starting today, counting backward. A value of `7` means that everything older than a week will be purged.

repack.name: Repack
repack.description: Attempt to save disk space by rewriting the entire database file.

apply_filter.name: Apply filter
apply_filter.description: Apply `entity_id` and `event_type` filters in addition to time-based purge.

purge_entities.name: Purge entities
purge_entities.description: Starts a purge task to remove the data related to specific entities from your database.

entity_id.name: Entities to remove
entity_id.description: List of entities for which the data is to be removed from the recorder database.

domains.name: Domains to remove
domains.description: List of domains for which the data needs to be removed from the recorder database.

entity_globs.name: Entity globs to remove
entity_globs.description: List of glob patterns used to select the entities for which the data is to be removed from the recorder database.

keep_days.name: Days to keep
keep_days.description: Number of days to keep the data for rows matching the filter. Starting today, counting backward. A value of `7` means that everything older than a week will be purged. The default of 0 days will remove all matching rows immediately.

enable.name: Enable
enable.description: Starts the recording of events and state changes.

disable.name: Disable
disable.description: Stops the recording of events and state changes.

addon_update.name: Update add-on.
addon_update.description: Updates an add-on. This action should be used with caution since add-on updates can contain breaking changes. It is highly recommended that you review release notes/change logs before updating an add-on.

password.name: Password
password.description: Password to protect the backup with.

location.name: Location
location.description: Name of a backup network storage to host backups.

homeassistant_exclude_database.name: Home Assistant exclude database
homeassistant_exclude_database.description: Exclude the Home Assistant database file from backup

homeassistant.name: Home Assistant settings
homeassistant.description: Includes Home Assistant settings in the backup.

homeassistant_exclude_database.name: Home Assistant exclude database
homeassistant_exclude_database.description: Exclude the Home Assistant database file from backup

addons.name: Add-ons
addons.description: List of add-ons to include in the backup. Use the name slug of the add-on.

folders.name: Folders
folders.description: List of directories to include in the backup.

password.name: Password
password.description: Password to protect the backup with.

location.name: Location
location.description: Name of a backup network storage to host backups.

slug.name: Slug
slug.description: Slug of backup to restore from.

slug.name: Slug
slug.description: Slug of backup to restore from.

folders.name: Folders
folders.description: List of directories to include in the backup.

addons.name: Add-ons
addons.description: List of add-ons to include in the backup. Use the name slug of the add-on.

install.name: Install update
install.description: Installs an update for this device or service.

version.name: Version
version.description: The version to install. If omitted, the latest version will be installed.

backup.name: Backup
backup.description: If supported by the integration, this creates a backup before starting the update .

skip.name: Skip update
skip.description: Marks currently available update as skipped.

clear_skipped.name: Clear skipped update
clear_skipped.description: Removes the skipped version marker from an update.

remote_connect.name: Remote connect
remote_connect.description: Makes the instance UI accessible from outside of the local network by using Home Assistant Cloud.

remote_disconnect.name: Remote disconnect
remote_disconnect.description: Disconnects the Home Assistant UI from the Home Assistant Cloud. You will no longer be able to access your Home Assistant instance from outside your local network.

start.name: Start
start.description: Sends a start command to a ffmpeg based sensor.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: Name of entity that will start. Platform dependent.

stop.name: Stop
stop.description: Sends a stop command to a ffmpeg based sensor.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: Name of entity that will stop. Platform dependent.

restart.name: Restart
restart.description: Sends a restart command to a ffmpeg based sensor.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: Name of entity that will restart. Platform dependent.

speak.name: Speak
speak.description: Speaks something using text-to-speech on a media player.

media_player_entity_id.name: Media player entity
media_player_entity_id.description: Media players to play the message.

message.name: Message
message.description: The text you want to convert into speech so that you can listen to it on your device.

cache.name: Cache
cache.description: Stores this message locally so that when the text is requested again, the output can be produced more quickly.

language.name: Language
language.description: Language to use for speech generation.

clear_cache.name: Clear TTS cache
clear_cache.description: Removes all cached text-to-speech files and purges the memory.

cloud_say.name: Say a TTS message with cloud
cloud_say.description: Say something using text-to-speech on a media player with cloud.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: Reloads the scenes from the YAML-configuration.

entities.name: Entities state
entities.description: List of entities and their target state.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Time it takes the devices to transition into the states defined in the scene.

scene_id.name: Scene entity ID
scene_id.description: The entity ID of the new scene.

entities.name: Entities state
entities.description: List of entities and their target state. If your entities are already in the target state right now, use `snapshot_entities` instead.

snapshot_entities.name: Snapshot entities
snapshot_entities.description: List of entities to be included in the snapshot. By taking a snapshot, you record the current state of those entities. If you do not want to use the current state of all your entities for this scene, you can combine the `snapshot_entities` with `entities`.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Time it takes the devices to transition into the states defined in the scene.

decrement.name: Decrement
decrement.description: Decrements the current value by 1 step.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the last to the first option on the list.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the last to the first option on the list.

trigger.name: Trigger
trigger.description: Triggers the actions of an automation.

skip_condition.name: Skip conditions
skip_condition.description: Defines whether or not the conditions will be skipped.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Duration the timer requires to finish. [optional].

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Duration to add or subtract to the running timer.

turn_on.name: Turn on
turn_on.description: Runs the sequence of actions defined in a script.

toggle.name: Toggle
toggle.description: Toggle a script. Starts it, if isn't running, stops it otherwise.

press.name: Press
press.description: Mimics the physical button press on the device.

log.name: Log
log.description: Creates a custom entry in the logbook.

name.name: Name
name.description: Custom name for an entity, can be referenced using an `entity_id`.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity to reference in the logbook entry.

domain.name: Domain
domain.description: Determines which icon is used in the logbook entry. The icon illustrates the integration domain related to this logbook entry.

process.name: Process
process.description: Launches a conversation from a transcribed text.

language.name: Language
language.description: Language of text. Defaults to server language.

agent_id.name: Agent
agent_id.description: Conversation agent to process your request. The conversation agent is the brains of your assistant. It processes the incoming text commands.

conversation_id.name: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: ID of the conversation, to be able to continue a previous conversation

language.name: Language
language.description: Language to clear cached intents for. Defaults to server language.

timestamp.name: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The target date & time, expressed by a UNIX timestamp.

add_item.name: Add item
add_item.description: Adds an item to the shopping list.

name.name: Name
name.description: The name of the item to add.

remove_item.name: Remove item
remove_item.description: Removes the first item with matching name from the shopping list.

name.name: Name
name.description: The name of the item to remove.

complete_item.name: Complete item
complete_item.description: Marks the first item with matching name as completed in the shopping list.

name.name: Name
name.description: The name of the item to mark as completed (without removing).

incomplete_item.name: Incomplete item
incomplete_item.description: Marks the first item with matching name as incomplete in the shopping list.

name.name: Name
name.description: The name of the item to mark as incomplete.

complete_all.name: Complete all
complete_all.description: Marks all items as completed in the shopping list (without removing them from the list).

incomplete_all.name: Incomplete all
incomplete_all.description: Marks all items as incomplete in the shopping list.

clear_completed_items.name: Clear completed items
clear_completed_items.description: Clears completed items from the shopping list.

sort.name: Sort all items
sort.description: Sorts all items by name in the shopping list.

reverse.name: Sort reverse
reverse.description: Whether to sort in reverse (descending) order.

value.name: Value
value.description: The new counter value the entity should be set to.

toggle.name: Toggle
toggle.description: Toggles climate device, from on to off, or off to on.

set_cover_position.name: Set position
set_cover_position.description: Moves a cover to a specific position.

set_cover_tilt_position.name: Set tilt position
set_cover_tilt_position.description: Moves a cover tilt to a specific position.

increase_speed.name: Increase speed
increase_speed.description: Increases the speed of the fan.

percentage_step.name: Increment
percentage_step.description: Increases the speed by a percentage step.

decrease_speed.name: Decrease speed
decrease_speed.description: Decreases the speed of the fan.

percentage_step.name: Decrement
percentage_step.description: Decreases the speed by a percentage step.

turn_on.name: Turn on
turn_on.description: Turn on one or more lights and adjust properties of the light, even when they are turned on already.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Duration it takes to get to next state.

rgb_color.name: Color
rgb_color.description: The color in RGB format. A list of three integers between 0 and 255 representing the values of red, green, and blue.

brightness_pct.name: Brightness
brightness_pct.description: Number indicating the percentage of full brightness, where 0 turns the light off, 1 is the minimum brightness, and 100 is the maximum brightness.

turn_off.name: Turn off
turn_off.description: Turn off one or more lights.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Duration it takes to get to next state.

toggle.name: Toggle
toggle.description: Toggles one or more lights, from on to off, or, off to on, based on their current state.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Duration it takes to get to next state.

rgb_color.name: Color
rgb_color.description: The color in RGB format. A list of three integers between 0 and 255 representing the values of red, green, and blue.

brightness_pct.name: Brightness
brightness_pct.description: Number indicating the percentage of full brightness, where 0 turns the light off, 1 is the minimum brightness, and 100 is the maximum brightness.

code.name: Code
code.description: Code used to unlock the lock.

code.name: Code
code.description: Code used to lock the lock.

code.name: Code
code.description: Code used to open the lock.

set_value.name: Set
set_value.description: Sets the value of a number.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the last to the first.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the first to the last.

set_valve_position.name: Set position
set_valve_position.description: Moves a valve to a specific position.

add_item.name: Add to-do list item
add_item.description: Add a new to-do list item.

item.name: Item name
item.description: The name that represents the to-do item.

due_date.name: Due date
due_date.description: The date the to-do item is expected to be completed.

due_datetime.name: Due date and time
due_datetime.description: The date and time the to-do item is expected to be completed.

description.example: A more complete description of the to-do item than that provided by the summary.
description.name: Description
description.description: A more complete description of the to-do item than provided by the item name.

update_item.name: Update to-do list item
update_item.description: Update an existing to-do list item based on its name.

item.name: Item name
item.description: The name for the to-do list item.

rename.name: Rename item
rename.description: The new name of the to-do item

status.name: Set status
status.description: A status or confirmation of the to-do item.

due_date.name: Due date
due_date.description: The date the to-do item is expected to be completed.

due_datetime.name: Due date and time
due_datetime.description: The date and time the to-do item is expected to be completed.

description.example: A more complete description of the to-do item than that provided by the summary.
description.name: Description
description.description: A more complete description of the to-do item than provided by the item name.

remove_item.name: Remove a to-do list item
remove_item.description: Remove an existing to-do list item by its name.

item.name: Item name
item.description: The name for the to-do list items.

get_items.name: Get to-do list items
get_items.description: Get items on a to-do list.

status.name: Status
status.description: Only return to-do items with the specified statuses. Returns not completed actions by default.

remove_completed_items.name: Remove all completed to-do list items
remove_completed_items.description: Remove all to-do list items that have been completed.

persistent_notification.name: Send a persistent notification
persistent_notification.description: Sends a notification that is visible in the notifications panel.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.
message.name: Message

data.name: Data
data.description: Some integrations provide extended functionality. For information on how to use _data_, refer to the integration documentation..

mobile_app_lucas_iphone.name: Send a notification via mobile_app_lucas_iphone
mobile_app_lucas_iphone.description: Sends a notification message using the mobile_app_lucas_iphone integration.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.

notify.name: Send a notification with notify
notify.description: Sends a notification message using the notify service.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.

dev_id.name: Device ID
dev_id.description: ID of the device (find the ID in `known_devices.yaml`).

location_name.name: Location
location_name.description: Name of the location where the device is located. The options are: `home`, `not_home`, or the name of the zone.

gps.name: GPS coordinates
gps.description: GPS coordinates where the device is located, specified by latitude and longitude (for example: [51.513845, -0.100539]).

type.name: Forecast type
type.description: Forecast type: daily, hourly or twice daily.
